"Kushner's masterpiece is a joy to watch, but it's also, admittedly, a labor...Kushner's brilliance...still wavers in the never-perfected 'Perestroika'...Elliott's swift-moving production sometimes sways toward sentimentalism...The play cringes whenever Kushner's poor-theater aesthetic is punched aside by something so blatantly Hollywood...Garfield delivers a performance of absolute clarion rightness...These little quibbles donâ€™t stain the glory one jot. This Visitation is unmissable."
